Under separate cover we are sending you some materials which will give you
more information about the Association. Of course. Associate and Affiliate
members do not receive as many of these materials as regularly as Active
members do.
In addition. Active members with radio stations may use the facilities of
the NABB Radio Network upon payment of an annual assessment fee. The Net¬
work distributes approximately eight hours of programming, by tape record¬
ing, weekly, to members subscribing to its service. This fee is also based
on power (with the same power classifications as membership) and a new sta¬
tion does not have to pay the full fee until the third year it is in the
Network. The fees are:

Stations must also pay postage both ways on the tapes shipped to and from
Network Headquarters here in Urbana, Illinois. Still even a Class A sta¬
tion paying its full third-year rate is paying only a little over $2.00
an hour for better than 1*00 hours of programming from the Network in a
year. This is about the most inexpensive programming a station can do.
If, after looking over the materials which we shall send you, you have fur¬
ther questions, we shall be most happy to answer them.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
